content: Retirement Asked by AnonymousAsked on 24 Sep 2018How you define retirement? And how old you current plan for the retirement?5 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (5)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent
Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 07 Jun 2019I define retirement as having enough passive income to sustain my monthly expenses. I hope to reach this goal by 45 years old! 2 comments1

Kelvid Pang26 Sep 2018Wau, before 45 is a stretch goal.. I believe if you start young, this is not a dream.Yong Kah Hwee26 Sep 2018Thanks for the encouragement! I am currently 25, with 20 years to achieve this. i'll do my best :)

Gabriel LeeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 25 Sep 2018Being able to live comfortably/decently without having to worry about financial issues and not having to continue working after the retirement age. 0 comments1

Nicholas ChanLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 24 Sep 2018When u choose not to work anymore because your wealth is greater than your future projected expenses. Make use of CPF, put more into your SA. 0 comments1
